fields.name: configuration
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT configuration_data FROM service_configuration WHERE  id = 'sophora.configuration.commonDisplayTexts' ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns the configuration for the client application.

fields.name: configurationByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT configuration_data FROM service_configuration WHERE  canonical = $1 ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns the configuration for the client application by canonical.

fields.name: configurationById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT configuration_data FROM service_configuration WHERE  id = $1 ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns the configuration for the client application by id.

fields.name: getDocumentTypeByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT  UPPER(type) as document_type  FROM app_public.document WHERE canonical = $1 AND is_deleted = false order by feed_date desc LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a document type by canonical.*With latest feed date, if multiple documents are found.

fields.name: getDocumentTypeById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT  UPPER(type) as document_type  FROM app_public.document WHERE id = $1 AND is_deleted = false LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a document type by id.

fields.name: getDocumentChangeLog
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM document_history ```
  
**COMMENT**: Used to store information about changes in the documents. Consumed by the Indexing Service.

fields.name: videos
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM video WHERE internal___visible = true; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of videos. *Visible video only.

fields.name: videosByIds
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM video WHERE id=ANY($1) AND internal___visible = true ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of videos by their ids. *Visible videos only.

fields.name: videoById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM video WHERE id=$1 AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single video by id. *Visible video only.

fields.name: videoByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM video WHERE (canonical = $1 OR $1 = ANY(internal___canonical_history)) AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single video by canonical. *Visible video only.

fields.name: smartCollections
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM smart_collection WHERE internal___visible = true; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of smart collections. *Visible smart collections only.

fields.name: smartCollectionsByIds
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM smart_collection WHERE id=ANY($1) AND internal___visible = true ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of smart collections by their ids. *Visible smart collections only.

fields.name: smartCollectionById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM smart_collection WHERE id=$1 AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single smart collection by id. *Visible smart collection only.

fields.name: smartCollectionByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` ``` SELECT * FROM smart_collection WHERE (canonical = $1 OR $1 = ANY(internal___canonical_history)) AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ``` ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single smart collection by canonical. *Visible video only.

fields.name: metaCollections
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM meta_collection WHERE internal___visible = true; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of meta collections. *Visible meta collections only.

fields.name: metaCollectionById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM meta_collection WHERE id=$1 AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single meta collection by id. *Visible meta collection only.

fields.name: metaCollectionByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM meta_collection WHERE (canonical = $1 OR $1 = ANY(internal___canonical_history)) AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single meta collection by canonical. *Visible video only.

fields.name: textPages
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM text_page WHERE internal___visible = true; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of text pages. *Visible text pages only.

fields.name: textPagesByIds
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM text_page WHERE id=ANY($1) AND internal___visible = true ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of text pages by their ids. *Visible text pages only.

fields.name: textPageById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM text_page WHERE id=$1 AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single text page by id. *Visible text page only.

fields.name: textPageByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM text_page WHERE (canonical = $1 OR $1 = ANY(internal___canonical_history)) AND internal___visible = true LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single text page by canonical. *Visible video only.

fields.name: specialPages
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM catalog UNION __ more tables __ ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a list of special pages

fields.name: specialPageById
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM catalog UNION __ more tables __ WHERE id=$1 LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single special page by id

fields.name: specialPageByCanonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` SELECT * FROM catalog UNION __ more tables __ WHERE canonical=$1 LIMIT 1; ```
  
**COMMENT**: Returns a single special page by canonical

fields.name: recommendation
fields.description: DEPRECATED in favor of smartCollectionRecommendation: Get a recommendation for a SmartCollection

args.name: collectionId
args.description: ID of the (Curated) Collection where the request is coming from

fields.name: smartCollectionRecommendation
fields.description: Get a recommendation for a SmartCollection

args.name: collectionId
args.description: ID of the SmartCollection for which recommendations are requested

fields.name: nextVideo
fields.description: Get a next video based on a provided video

args.name: videoId
args.description: ID of the video that the user is currently watching

fields.name: metaCollectionContent
fields.description: Get content items for a MetaCollection

args.name: searchResultsHistory
args.description: search results previously clicked by the user

fields.name: cluster
fields.description: Get a single P/A cluster

args.name: collectionId
args.description: ID of the (Curated) Collection where the request is coming from

fields.name: clusterlist
fields.description: Get a list of P/A clusters

args.name: collectionId
args.description: ID of the (Curated) Collection where the request is coming from

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
**COMMENT**: Required unique identifier. 
  
**EN**: Unique identifier

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: BigFloat
types.description: A floating point number that requires more precision than IEEE 754 binary 64

types.name: StreamAnchorTagsConnection
types.description: A connection to a list of `StreamAnchorTag` values.

fields.name: nodes
fields.description: A list of `StreamAnchorTag` objects.

fields.name: edges

fields.name: pageInfo

fields.description: The count of *all* `StreamAnchorTag` you could get from the connection.

types.name: StreamAnchorTagsEdge
types.description: A `StreamAnchorTag` edge in the connection.

fields.name: cursor
fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.name: node
fields.description: The `StreamAnchorTag` at the end of the edge.

types.name: Cursor
types.description: A location in a connection that can be used for resuming pagination.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
**COMMENT**: Required unique identifier. 
  
**EN**: Unique identifier

types.name: Datetime
types.description:
A point in time as described by the [ISO
8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) and, if it has a timezone, [RFC
3339](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3339) standards. Input values
that do not conform to both ISO 8601 and RFC 3339 may be coerced, which may lead
to unexpected results.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` root.externalId ```
  
**COMMENT**: The document importer will get the externalId value via the PubSub as follows: SCMS_c103b06e-7194-4638-93c9-448671489ad3. But then the importer would just take the UUID (ie c103b06e-7194-4638-93c9-448671489ad3) and store it in the database. It is then displayed as an id field via the GQL API. 
  
**EN**: Unique document identifier.

fields.name: canonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` root.id ```
  
**COMMENT**: Required unique identifier. 
  
**EN**: A user-readable unique identifier.

types.name: BigInt
types.description:
A signed eight-byte integer. The upper big integer values are greater than the
max value for a JavaScript number. Therefore all big integers will be output as
strings and not numbers.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` root.externalId ```
  
**COMMENT**: The document importer will get the externalId value via the PubSub as follows: SCMS_c103b06e-7194-4638-93c9-448671489ad3. But then the importer would just take the UUID (ie c103b06e-7194-4638-93c9-448671489ad3) and store it in the database. It is then displayed as an id field via the GQL API. 
  
**EN**: Unique document identifier. 
  
**DE**: Eindeutiger Dokumentbezeichner.

fields.name: canonical
fields.description:
**SOURCE**: ``` root.id ```
  
**COMMENT**: Required unique identifier. 
  
**EN**: A user-readable unique identifier. 
  
**DE**: Eine vom Benutzer lesbare eindeutige Kennung.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates exactly one field must be supplied and this field must not be `null`.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
